Responsibilities to a Child in Care. A kinship caregiver shall:
Assist the local department in maintaining and improving the child in care'
Maintain an attitude of respect and understanding towards the child in care
Provide regular updates and information about the child in care's life; and
Serve as a role model for the child in care’s parents or legal guardians.
Responsibilities to a Child in Care's Family. A kinship caregiver shall:
Work as a team member in assessing a child in care's strengths and needs, a
Update the local department on the child in care's development and adjustme
Attend case reviews and meetings as requested by the local department;
Employment and child care arrangements;
Composition of the household;
Address, telephone number, and email address;
Health status; and
Stressful conditions that may affect the child in care.
Immediately notify the local department of changes within the kinship careg
Provide at least 30 days notice when requesting a child in care be moved ex
Report any suspected incidence of child physical or sexual abuse or neglect
Notify the local department if a child in care runs away or otherwise canno
